metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9597 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The picture_pool_Delete function in misc/picture_pool.c in VideoLAN VLCmedia player 2.1.5 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code orcause a denial of service (DEP violation and application crash) via acrafted FLV file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9597` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc5 - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.2
libvlccore7 - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.2
vlc - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.2
vlc-data - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.2
vlc-nox - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.2
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.2
vlc-plugin-jack - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.2
vlc-plugin-notify - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.2
vlc-plugin-pulse - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.2
vlc-plugin-sdl - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.2
vlc-plugin-svg - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.2
vlc-plugin-zvbi - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vlc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.2').
